post_text: Dear MCR-II Parents, the MCR-II School District has been working with state agencies so all our students could have free breakfasts and lunches. Today (9/10/20), our district was notified that all MCR-II students who are currently enrolled “in seat”, will not have to pay for any breakfast or lunch, through December 22, 2020. Both of these meals must be a totally reimbursable meal, meaning that it must meet the USDA requirement of an entrée, fruit, vegetable, and milk. If your student chooses only an ala-carte item, or just a milk, their account will be charged for those items. The Department of Health and Senior Services (agency overseeing this food service program) is allowing districts to back date the start of this program to September 1. This means that student meal accounts will not show a charge from September 1 through December 22. However, families will still be required to pay for any meal debt accrued through August 31, 2020.

SEEDBEARERS

The group of young adults that visit our community each summer for a week, staying at the Montogmery County Middle School, and helping residents perform work/repairs on their homes has cancelled for the summer of 2020.

Their planning, fundraising, purchasing of materials and coordinating with home owners start now around mid-May. As a result of the unknowns involved with COVID-19, they have reluctantly cancelled their efforts for this summer.

They have indicated that they plan, if allowed by regulations, to return to our community next summer (2021) and begin their work again.

This is a group of young men and women who dedicate one week each summer to come to Montomgery City and help make repairs to homeowners residences that the homeowner may struggle to get completed or pay for. These young men and women spend this week without computers or cell phones. They have slept and eaten the first couple of years at the Montgomery County Middle School and we look forward to hosting them next summer (2021).

State statute requires school Districts to include 36 hours of inclement weather days in each year's calendar. After utilizing those 36 hours, a District is required to make up half of the next 48 hours of canceled school or a total of 24 hours.
After the original 36 hours and the next 24 hours (total of 60 hours) any time missed is forgiven. Hours needed to be made up can be in a number of ways (i.e.- time added to each day, utilize Mondays, etc.)

New state statutes deals with only hours not days anymore. A District is required to hold a minimun of 1,044 hours of instruction each year to get full state aide.

The MCR2 Board of Education will be discussing this issue at thier February 13th Board Meeting. The Board will provide the Superintendent direction on how to make up any hours, if needed.

post_text: It appears the rain has ended. We will be running roads shortly attempting to forecast what the roads will be like at our normal dismissal time. If MCR2 decides to release early today, notices will be sent via School Messenger. For MCR2 to count the day as a school day we must have 4 hours of instructional time (recess, passing and lunch time does not count toward the required 4 hours). The earliest our District can dismiss and count the day as attendance would be approximately 12:50 P.M. That happens to be close to the end of the an elementary lunch period, so to allow the students to get fed and back to their classroom it would likely be more like 1:00 to 1:15 P.M. On days such as this we strive to keep the students all day as we always fear students being home alone or unable to get into their home. However, the weather may dictate otherwise. It would be prudent to have alternative plans in case of early dismissals.

The SeedBearers Group, a group of supervised high school aged young men and women, is looking for home repair projects for the summer of 2019. They will be in Montgomery City the week of July 21-27, 2019. They stay at the Montgomery County Middle School during this week.

They help people in Montgomery City who own a home that needs repairs and struggle financially or physically by purchasing the material and making the repairs. They will not perform work on rentals.

Last year was the first year for the SeedBearer group to work in Montgomery City. They replaced a roof, painted (inside and outside), repaired a deck, landscaped yards, poured concrete sidewalks and stairs, etc. at some homes in Montgomery City. They provide the labor and material for most of their projects. They will take on most any project except a large electrical or plumbing project.

If you have a project (your own or an acquaintance) you would like the SeedBearer group to consider for the summer of 2019 or 2020, please e-mail your name, contact information and some details of the project to SB@impactym.org.
